measured_by: RVCN (Replication Value = average yearly citation count × sample size)
justification: The article states that “Replication value, denoted as RVCN, is calculated as the product of the average yearly citation count … and the sample size used to investigate the original study,” indicating that RVCN operationalises the construct of replication value.

The authors note, “To quantify this uncertainty, we advocated for the use of Bayes Factors (BFs), which assess the relative strength of evidence supporting two competing hypotheses,” directly linking the construct of uncertainty to measurement with Bayes Factors.
The commentary remarks that “Citation count is an imperfect indicator of scientific value,” explicitly treating citation count as the metric used to gauge the construct of scientific value.
